docs.lead_paragraph: The report said that 44 million people, or one in seven residents, lived in poverty in the United States in 2009, the highest rate since 1994.

headline.main: Recession Raises Poverty Rate to a 15-Year High
headline.print_headline: RECESSION RAISES U.S. POVERTY RATE TO A 15-YEAR HIGH

docs.snippet: The report said that 44 million people, or one in seven residents, lived in poverty in the United States in 2009, the highest rate since 1994.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Rebecca Cathcart in Los Angeles, Emma Graves Fitzsimmons in Chicago, Malcolm Gay in St. Louis, Robert Gebeloff in New York and Malia Wollan in San Francisco.

docs.lead_paragraph: Former President Jimmy Carter this week offered a blunt, pull-no-punches assessment of who's to blame for a three-decade political stalemate in the passage of comprehensive health care reform. His answer: his longtime political rival Edward M. Kennedy, the Democratic senator from Massachusetts who died in 2009.

headline.main: Revisiting Rivalry, Carter Blames Kennedy for Blocking Health Care Reform in '70s

docs.abstract: Former Pres Jimmy Carter, in 60 Minutes interview that revives bitter political rivalry, blames late Sen Edward Kennedy for delaying passage of health care reform legislation that Carter proposed in 1978; photos (M)
docs.snippet: Former President Jimmy Carter this week offered a blunt, pull-no-punches assessment of who's to blame for a three-decade political stalemate in the passage of comprehensive health care reform.     His answer: his longtime political rival  Edward M....

docs.lead_paragraph: The Census Bureau released on Thursday the latest figures on how many Americans were without health insurance in 2009: 50.7 million people, an increase of almost 10 percent from the 46.3 million people without coverage in 2008.
docs.abstract: The data shows that for the first time since 1987 the number of people with insurance actually decreased.
docs.snippet: The data shows that for the first time since 1987 the number of people with insurance actually decreased.

docs.lead_paragraph: The government is urging retirement community operators to disclose more information about their finances to residents and prospective customers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Peter J. Henning follows issues involving securities law and white-collar crime for DealBook's White Collar Watch.

headline.main: Can You Run a Company From Jail?

docs.abstract: White Collar Watch examines the jailing of the chief executive of Horace Mann Educators on drunken-driving charges and considers when companies need to make timely disclosures to investors.
docs.snippet: White Collar Watch examines the jailing of the chief executive of Horace Mann Educators on drunken-driving charges and considers when companies need to make timely disclosures to investors.

docs.lead_paragraph: On Thursday, the Census will release its annual report on the economic health of the country. It's not likely to be pretty.
docs.abstract: It is likely to show another drop in median household income, aggravating an unimpressive, decade-long trend.
docs.snippet: It is likely to show another drop in median household income, aggravating an unimpressive, decade-long trend.

docs.lead_paragraph: More insurgent candidates are moving on to the general election after upsetting establishment opponents in Tuesday's primaries.
